.@SenJackyRosen and I picked up #BattleBornBreakfast right where we left off before the in-state work period. It was great hearing from Nevadans and giving @DTDyjack a public health style handshake! pic.twitter.com/ft9CDT3X3F
I stand ready to work with the members of this committee and the rest of my colleagues in the Senate to find a sustainable solution that ensures all parties have a voice in this process.
The current bill before this committee continues on an unworkable path that only delays the country from finding a solution to our nuclear waste dilemma.
That is why @SenJackyRosen and I have introduced alternative legislation that guarantees every state has a seat at the table.
All we are asking today is that Nevada is treated fairly, that it is treated the same as every other state. Congress should not, and cannot, shove nuclear waste down our throats.
Numerous studies have also found that the groundwater  around the repository is at risk of contamination, affecting communities across Nevada and California.

The federal government has spent $19 billion with little to show in result. No waste handling facilities. No railroad infrastructure needed for transporting waste into the site. All that exists at Yucca Mountain is a five mile hole in the ground.
That is why Nevadans have been united in the fight to ensure that not an ounce of nuclear waste makes it to Yucca Mountain.
I ask you to put yourselves in the shoes of Nevadans. Imagine having nuclear waste sent to your communities without your input, without a fair process.

Many believe Yucca Mountain is settled science. That Yucca Mountain was selected through a reasoned and thorough process or that Yucca Mountain is already equipped to receive nuclear waste. Well, they are wrong.

For over 30 years, many in Congress have been trying to force a repository facility on Nevada, despite the fact that Nevada does not generate or consume nuclear energy, and that Yucca Mountain is a seismically and geologically unfit site to store this dangerous material.

This morning, @SenJackyRosen and I are bringing Nevadans' voices with us as we testify in opposition to a bill that tries to once again shove nuclear waste down the throat of Nevadans by restarting Yucca Mountain. WATCH live:  http://facebook.com/SenatorCortezMasto/ …
